Film shows on Kim Il Sung's revolutionary history
articles.content:
Film shows on Kim Il Sung's revolutionary history 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Documentary and feature films dealing with the revolutionary history and immortal revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung are on show at cinema houses and other halls in different parts of the country on the occasion of his 7th death anniversary.
 Among them are "our people's honour of holding the great leader in high esteem," "they were always together for the sake of people", "The Great Life in 1994," "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Is Immortal" and other documentary films showing the greatness of his ideology, leadership and traits.    
 Feature films include "Star of Korea," "The Sun of the Nation" and "Forest Sway" representing the revolutionary history of the president.

articles.title: Remember-Kim Il Sung Preparatory Committee formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Remember-Kim Il Sung Preparatory Committee formed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The Jonnam preparatory committee to remember President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Kwangju, South Korea, on June 24 on the occasion of his 7th death anniversary, according to Seoul-based Voice of National Salvation.
 Present at the inaugural meeting were representatives from all walks of life in South Jolla Province including workers, peasants, students, professors, journalists, artistes, dissident figures and activists.    
 The meeting set the period from June 28 to July 8 to remember Kim Il Sung and declared its plan to hold multifarious events such as remember-Kim Il Sung meetings to present poems and songs and publication of booklets in this period.

articles.title: Military attaches' corps visits Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Military attaches' corps visits Korean Revolution Museum 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The military attaches' corps here visited the hall "the leader and comrades-in-arms" of the Korean Revolution Museum yesterday on the occasion of the 7th death anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
 Yan Jiangfeng, military attache of the Chinese embassy here, who is doyen of the military attaches' corps, said that the visit to the museum provided them with an opportunity to know well about the deep love and trust shown by President Kim Il Sung and supreme commander Kim Jong Il for the revolutionary comrades.    
 It is thanks to the two great leaders' warm comradeship for the revolutionary soldiers and their loyalty to the leaders that Korean socialism is making a triumphant advance, he added.

articles.title: DPRK shooters come first at Asian trap shooting championships
articles.content:
DPRK shooters come first at Asian trap shooting championships 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- DPRK men and women shooters gave a good account of themselves at the Asian trap shooting championships for 2001 ongoing in Bangkok, according to a news report.
 Pak Nam Su, Ra Sang Uk and Ri Myong Son scored 347 points to place first in the men's team skeet shooting medal event.    
 Pak Nam Su took the second place in the men's single skeet shooting medal event and Pak Jong Ran the third in the women's single skeet shooting medal event.

Anti-U.S. struggle of S. Korean students
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. struggle of S. Korean students 
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The 29th-term general student council of patriotic Hanyang, the 17th-term bright fellow federation of patriotic Hanyang, student council of patriotic Hanyang for Juche-oriented life and science and other students organisations put forward anti-U.S. slogans, according to a news report.
 Slogans called for struggling against the U.S. "Missile Defence" system, opening to the public the truth behind the massacres of civilians during the June 25, 1950 war and the Kwangju uprising in 1980 and making apology and compensation for them.    
 Slogans also demanded the pullout of the U.S. troops from South Korea and the abolition of the "Security Law."
